## Corruption - definitions

-   petty corruption
-   Grand corruption


## Corruption - definitions

-   petty corruption

    - low level officials
    - individual transactions for specific purposes

Examples:

-  bribes to traffic cops
-  extorting a small business owner
-  bribes to get a permit 


## Corruption - definitions

-   Grand corruption

    -   high level officials
    -   large sums of money
    -   large scale corruption

Examples:

- bribes to pass a law or regulation
- schemes to award large government contracts to friends or family

## Corruption - accountability and responsibility

Huey Long, "The Kingfish"

- Political boss of Lousiana
- Widely known to be corrupt, immensely popular
-  Louisiana Governor 1928-1932
- Impeached 1929, not convicted
- US Senator 1932-1935
- Investigated for ethics violations by Senate 1934

## Corruption - accountability and responsibility

William J. Jefferson

- Louisiana Congressman 1991-2009

        - July 30, 2005 Videotaped receiving a briefcase of cash in an Arlington hotel
        - August 3, 2005 FBI raid on his home found $90,000 in cash wrapped in aluminum foil in his freezer
        - May 2006 FBI raid on his Congressional office
        - December 2006 - re-elected in a runoff with 57\% of the vote
        - Indicted 2007 on 16 counts of corruption
        - November 2008 - lost re-election to Anh "Joseph" Cao on a 49.55/% to 46.8% vote
        - Convicted 2009 on 11 counts of corruption

- Re-elected during corruption investigation after being caught with $90,000 in cash in his freezer
- Got 46.8% of the vote in the next election after being indicted


## Corruption - accountability and responsibility

Electoral
